label: ePO Threat Event Example
info:
This sample registers with the DXL fabric to receive threat event notifications
from ePO via the ePO DXL service. The payload in the event message received from
the DXL fabric is printed to the Node-RED `debug` tab.

### Prerequisites

* The samples configuration step has been completed (see the
  [DXL Configuration Sample](https://github.com/opendxl/node-red-contrib-dxl/wiki/Client-Configuration)).
* The ePO DXL service is running
  (see [Running Service](https://opendxl.github.io/opendxl-epo-service-python/pydoc/running.html)).
* The client is authorized to receive "ePO Threat Event Automatic Response Events"
  (see [Client Authorization](https://opendxl.github.io/opendxl-epo-service-python/pydoc/authorization.html#client-authorization)).

### Setup

* To deploy the flow, press the `Deploy` button in the upper-right corner of the
  screen. If Node-RED is able to properly connect to the DXL fabric, a green dot
  with the word `connected` should appear under the `Receive ePO threat event`
  node.

### Output

When an ePO threat event is received, the following output should appear in the
Node-RED `debug` tab:

```
â–¶ [ object ]
```

Click on the right arrow button to expand the contents of the object.

### Details

The flow exercises the nodes below.

#### Receive ePO threat event

This is an `epo threat event` input node which starts the flow. This node
injects a new message with a `payload` property which includes the information
from the threat event.

#### Output result

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` set on
the message by the `Receive ePO threat event` node.
